definition: to sacrifice one's life
to contribute/to donate/contribution/tax/to abandon
human body

sentences.english: I'm grateful to you for my sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 我謝謝您們爲我做出的捐軀。

sentences.english: She died heroical ly during an assault on the world's second-highest mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在向世界第二高峯的衝擊中，她壯烈捐軀了。

sentences.english: While millions were fighting and dying, the profiteers were lining their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 數百萬人在打仗捐軀，而奸商們卻趁機發不義之財。

sentences.english: Many a man has lived and died for his country.
sentences.chinese: 好多人爲國盡忠，爲國捐軀。

sentences.english: In the war of resistance against Japanese aggression, more than 70 Wha Chi fighters made their supreme sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 在抗擊日本侵略戰爭中，70多位華支戰士爲國捐軀。

sentences.english: We shed our blood for our country.
The little hero died for his country and people grieved over him for five days.
sentences.chinese: 這個小英雄爲國捐軀了，人們哀悼了他五天。

sentences.english: His son gave his life for the country while he gave his life to teaching.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子爲國捐軀而他卻投身於教學。

sentences.english: More than 35 million of excellent sons and daughters of the Chinese nation died for their motherland.
sentences.chinese: 3500多萬中華民族的優秀兒女爲國捐軀。

definition: Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to die in battle (idiom)
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to resist the enemy
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to defect/to surrender/to capitulate
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
to die/to perish
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
glorious achievement (idiom)
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
